page.title: 06ST. CATHERINE FISH TANKS
page.content:
A number of cold sea-water tanks have been built in some of the tunnels which were made during the German Occupation. These are inside an enormous rock, locally nicknamed {'Gibraltar',}which is at the end of the breakwater nearest to the land. These tanks are filled with shanker crabs, spider crabs and lobsters. The last time I went there they had a monk-fish as a sort of pet. My dad buys all his crabs and lobsters from there for his restaurant.
Most of the fish are caught more or less the same day, and taken there to be quite fresh. They are sold fairly cheaply, so many people get a crab or two from there. It is a damp atmosphere and very cold, but it is worth a visit next time you go down there.
